duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with the interprofessional team to deliver quality patient care under the direction of a licensed nurse.
Function as the coordinator of communication for the unit and assume primary responsibility for medical record management.
Facilitate patient data management through transcription, order entry, and documentation.
Support best use of resources in management of equipment, supplies, and other department resources.
Ensure complete room set up for new admission and conduct orientation for the patient and family members.
Communicate changes in patient's condition and take rapid action in life-threatening situations.
Comply with hospital infection control policies and safety procedures for equipment use.
Obtain, organize, and maintain patient charts and electronic medical records.
Ensure timely teletracking updates/requests and accurate disposition of patient requiring admission, transfer, or discharge.
Retrieve diagnostic study, lab results, and other relevant patient information supportive of patient assessment.

education_certification.credential: AHA Basic Life Support for Healthcare Professional (AHA BLS Healthcare) - American Heart Association -REQUIRED
Certification Comparable to certified nursing assistant course.
1 Year recent experience in geriatric setting or recent experience in an acute care hospital.
